title: Asian stocks mixed; dollar weakens before Fed rate decision
summary: Asian currencies strengthened as the dollar weakened to a four-year low, driven by investor caution over unpredictable US policymaking. The dollar's decline accelerated after President Trump expressed indifference to its fall, fueling speculation about coordinated intervention. This backdrop precedes the Fed's interest-rate decision and a crucial week for megacap tech earnings.

title: Stocks in news: Vodafone Idea, Hindustan Zinc, Vedanta, Marico, Vishal Mega Mart, Maruti and L&T
summary: Indian benchmark indices closed mixed on Tuesday, with the Nifty gaining on financial, IT, and metal stocks while the Sensex saw pressure from auto and FMCG. Several companies like Vodafone Idea, Vedanta, Marico, and Maruti Suzuki are in focus today due to their recent financial results and corporate actions.

title: Pre-market action: Here's the trade setup for today's session
summary: Indian stock indices Nifty and Sensex closed higher on Tuesday, driven by gains in financials, IT, and metals, despite selling in auto and FMCG sectors. The Nifty experienced a 300-point swing during the monthly expiry session. Analysts suggest a 'sell-on-rise' strategy until Nifty decisively breaks above 25,500.

title: Auto companies fall on fear of more EU imports
summary: Indian auto stocks experienced a decline following reports of potential tariff reductions on EU-imported vehicles as part of a free trade agreement. While some manufacturers like Mahindra & Mahindra and Hyundai saw sharper drops due to their presence in higher-priced segments, analysts believe the near-term impact will be limited, with the luxury segment being the primary area affected.

title: RBI, European body ink MoU to end clearing house standoff
summary: The Reserve Bank of India and the European Securities and Markets Authority have signed a memorandum of understanding, resolving a two-year dispute over supervisory oversight of India's central clearing agencies. This agreement facilitates cooperation and information exchange, paving the way for European recognition of Indian clearing houses and potentially enhancing European access to India's financial markets.

title: Stock Radar: Hindustan Unilever forming base after falling over 10% from highs; time to buy?
summary: Hindustan Unilever stock is nearing a technical rebound. Experts suggest buying for a target of Rs 2,600. The stock has consolidated near its 50-day moving average. A close above Rs 2,450 is key for momentum. Selective large caps like Hindustan Unilever can act as defensive plays in current market conditions. Traders should watch for buying opportunities above Rs 2,450.

title: Shapoorji Pallonji Group looks to raise up to $2.5 billion to refinance debt
summary: The proposed fundraise will be used to refinance a dollar bond backed by shares of Tata Sons, held through group entity Goswami Infratech, due to mature in April. The new transaction is expected to mirror the structure of the earlier deal, with Tata Sons shares continuing as collateral.

title: RBI's 'core company' tag puts many promoter entities in a quandary
summary: Corporate entities are navigating a fresh mandate from the Reserve Bank of India, which has reclassified holding and strategic investment firms as Core Investment Companies. This new label comes with a wave of rigorous regulations that many corporations are eager to sidestep, arguing that their revenue streams stem from non-financial sectors rather than financial endeavors.

title: PSBs shun low yields, high costs to protect margins
summary: Seven out of eight public sector banks that released quarterly results so far held on to or improved margins from the previous three months, helping them maintain profitability despite a challenging macro environment.

title: RBI dividend may rise to Rs 3L-cr in FY27
summary: Estimates broadly peg the dividend to be around ₹3 lakh crore, compared with ₹2.7 lakh crore last year. RBI dividends have provided a significant boost to the government's non-tax revenues in recent years.

title: Credit card spends bounce back in Dec, numbers also rise
summary: Credit card usage in Mumbai saw an 8% rebound last month, reaching ₹2.05 lakh crore due to seasonal demand and year-end spending. Net new card additions hit a three-month high of over 900,000, boosting the total active cards to 115.7 million. Analysts anticipate steady spending momentum, supported by ongoing consumption trends and festive demand.

summary: The ancient asset is attracting new investors

summary: A White Marubozu is a bullish candlestick pattern in technical analysis that forms when the opening price is the lowest and the closing price is the highest for a given session.

summary: Vodafone Idea shares are expected to be watched closely. The telecom operator reported lower losses for the December quarter. Revenue saw a slight increase. Capital expenditure was reported, along with debt and cash balances. Technical indicators suggest near-term pressure but long-term support.

title: Shadowfax Technologies shares to list today. GMP signals lukewarm debut
summary: Shadowfax Technologies is set to debut on Indian exchanges, but weakening grey market signals and uneven IPO demand point to a subdued start, highlighting investor caution toward new-age logistics listings amid fragile market sentiment.

title: South Korea's KOSPI posts sharpest rise in 3 weeks as investors buy the Trump tariff dip
summary: South Korean stocks saw a significant jump on Tuesday. This surge was powered by a strong rally in technology shares, boosted by global demand for artificial intelligence. The market shrugged off a threat from US President Donald Trump to increase tariffs on Korean goods. Chipmakers Samsung Electronics and SK Hynix led the gains. Automakers also recovered from initial dips.

title: Indonesian stocks tumble 7% after MSCI applies interim freeze on investability risks
summary: Indonesia's stock market experienced a sharp 7% drop early Wednesday after MSCI announced a freeze on certain index changes. This decision stems from investor concerns regarding free float data transparency. Indonesian authorities are actively engaged in discussions with MSCI to resolve these issues, aiming to restore market confidence.

title: Vedanta, Hindustan Zinc shares in focus after OFS announcement
summary: Vedanta and Hindustan Zinc are in focus after Vedanta approved an Offer for Sale of up to 1.59% stake in Hindustan Zinc at a floor price of Rs 685 per share. Elevated RSI levels suggest strong momentum but raise near-term caution amid potential consolidation.

summary: On January 27, four stocks from the Nifty50 index entered the RSI Trending Up scan after their RSI crossed above the 50 mark from lower levels. This technical development signals improving price momentum and rising buying interest, often tracked by traders to identify potential upside and emerging bullish trends.

title: India’s $360 billion stock rout raises stakes for Modi’s Budget
summary: Indian stocks face their worst year start in a decade. Investors await the upcoming budget for economic growth catalysts. The government may boost defense spending and speed up state-run company share sales. Attention is on measures to stimulate consumption and domestic manufacturing. Specific sectors like defense, roads, and railways are expected to see increased allocations.

summary: Air India has made progress towards a turnaround in the Tata Group fold. But it’s far from a breakout, and catastrophic setbacks have not helped.

title: BYD could expand India operations as demand begins to outstrip supply
summary: BYD Co. is considering local assembly in India to meet rising demand for its electric vehicles and is seeking regulatory certifications. This follows previous rejections for a full assembly plant, reflecting a strategic shift as the company aims to expand amid growing sales in the Indian market.

title: SoftBank in discussions to invest $30 billion more in OpenAI, says report - what we know
summary: The move by SoftBank reflects CEO Masayoshi Son's ambitions to play a key role in developing artificial intelligence, which has taken over the world over the last few years.

title: Amazon layoffs: Tech giant mistakenly confirms sacking of cloud unit employees in email
summary: Employees in Amazon's cloud division, AWS, received a notice on Tuesday acknowledging “organizational changes” at the tech giant.&nbsp;

title: Amazon turns over a new leaf in physical stores. It’s about grocery delivery.
summary: Amazon.com is closing dozens of Amazon Go and Amazon Fresh physical stores to focus on expanding same-day delivery of groceries and adding to its Whole Foods operations.

title: Tax season turns attractive for Americans as Trump's One Big Beautiful Act delivers $1,000 in refunds
summary: The Internal Revenue Service officially started accepting 2025 tax returns on 26 January, launching a taxpaying season that the White House projects could deliver an additional $100 billion returns to taxpayers.

title: One year after DeepSeek, Chinese AI firms from Alibaba to Moonshot race to release new models
summary: Chinese companies are releasing new AI models and striving to gain an edge in the AI application race as the country's biggest holiday of the year nears.

title: MCX shares soar 14% in 2 sessions. What's triggering the rally?
summary: Multi Commodity Exchange of India (MCX) shares surged 7.5% after reporting a massive 151% year-on-year jump in consolidated net profit to Rs 401 crore for Q3FY26. Revenue from operations also saw a robust 121% YoY increase to Rs 666 crore, driven by significant growth in trading activity and new product launches.

title: Rs 3 lakh crore added! Sensex rises over 600 pts, Nifty tops 25,350; India-EU trade pact among key factors behind today's rally
summary: Indian equities surged to record highs on Wednesday, driven by a landmark trade agreement between India and the European Union. The pact, which significantly lowers tariffs on most goods, boosted investor confidence and amplified gains from a supportive global backdrop. This optimism added Rs 2.9 lakh crore to investor wealth.

title: Jefferies picks 10 stocks that could benefit from possible Budget 2026 announcements. Do you own any?
summary: Jefferies anticipates the upcoming Union Budget will prioritize defense-led capital expenditure and selective consumption support, with fiscal deficit targets around 4.2% of GDP. The brokerage highlights potential beneficiaries across renewables, real estate, hospitality, and defense sectors, expecting significant growth in defense capex.

title: Buy, Sell or Hold: Morgan Stanley remains bullish on CG Power; Goldman Sachs upgrades earnings outlook for Tata Consumer
summary: Leading brokerages have turned bullish on select industrial and consumer stocks. Morgan Stanley remains positive on CG Power, Goldman Sachs upgrades Tata Consumer earnings outlook, while Motilal Oswal sees a strong recovery at Raymond Lifestyle driven by improving fundamentals.

title: Is Budget day overrated? What 15 years of Nifty data reveals about post-Budget trades
summary: Historical Nifty data reveals that investors often miss opportunities by focusing on Budget Day theatrics. The average Budget Day move is minimal, with significant returns typically observed in the week following the event, suggesting patience and waiting for policy clarity is a more profitable strategy.

title: Asian Paints shares tank nearly 7% after Q3 results. Should you buy, sell or hold?
summary: Asian Paints shares dropped significantly after reporting a nearly 5% year-on-year profit decline for the December quarter. While sales saw a modest rise, analysts remain divided. Citi reiterates a 'Sell' rating, citing weak demand, while Morgan Stanley maintains 'Underweight' due to growth misses. Nomura, however, holds a 'Buy' rating, believing competitive pressures are easing.

title: A $1.7 trillion rally pushes Korea’s market cap above Germany’s
summary: South Korea has overtaken Germany in stock market capitalisation, fuelled by a powerful rally in technology stocks tied to the global AI and robotics boom. Market value has surged to $3.25 trillion after adding $1.7 trillion since early 2025, lifting Korea to the world’s 10th-largest equity market, supported by reforms and strong index performance.

summary: Maruti Suzuki Q3 Results LIVE: Maruti Suzuki is expected to report a strong December quarter, with brokerages forecasting healthy growth in revenue and profits, supported by robust volumes, favourable product mix and operating leverage, despite mixed margin trends.

title: 'My partner is alf-Indian': Elon Musk invokes Indian physicist while responding to Vinod Khosla’s racism allegation
summary: Elon Musk and Vinod Khosla are once again in a heated debate on social media after the Sun Microsystems founder accused the Tesla CEO of racism. Musk countered with personal attacks while highlighting his partner's Indian heritage and past claims about Khosla's beach access restrictions.

summary: Executives from Airbus, AstraZeneca and HSBC are joining Prime Minister Keir Starmer on a rare China visit, highlighting the business focus of the trip amid strained global trade relations.

title: Tata Consumer Products shares tumble 5% after Q3. What should investors do?
summary: Tata Consumer Products shares dropped significantly on Wednesday. This occurred even as the company reported a 38% year-on-year profit jump and 15% revenue increase for the December quarter. Analysts from Morgan Stanley, Motilal Oswal, and JM Financial provided their views on the stock. Their recommendations range from Overweight to Buy and ADD, with varying price targets.

title: ITC Q3 results preview: Revenue to grow up to 8.4% YoY on cigarette volume growth. 6 things to watch
summary: ITC is expected to report moderate revenue and profit growth in Q3, supported by cigarette volume recovery and margin expansion. However, brokerages remain divided on profit estimates amid concerns over pricing pressures and potential cigarette tax hikes.

title: Budget & the Stock Market: The ‘policy risk’ number in the budget that the market tends to ignore – but should not
summary: This is the number in the Union Budget that the market does not often focus on, but one which influences fiscal outcomes, inflation outcomes, and, therefore, market discount rates. For investors, it is important to remember that this number reveals “policy risk” much before it shows up later through the Revised Estimates, supplementary demands, or re-prioritisation within the revenue account.

title: Reliance's EU exports in limbo as Russian crude rules sow confusion: Nomura
summary: Reliance’s refined product exports to Europe face rising uncertainty as EU rules on Russian crude create compliance confusion. Tanker diversions and inconsistent enforcement across member states add pressure, while limited Venezuelan crude supplies complicate India’s shift away from Russian oil. RIL shares have fallen amid these concerns.
